FuncDef:
The ds-lite time command sets the start time, end time, or timestamp in flexible DS-Lite syslogs to the local time or UTC time.
The undo ds-lite time command deletes the setting of the local or UTC time for the start time, end time, or timestamp in flexible DS-Lite syslogs.
By default, a device displays the UTC time in flexible Ds-lite syslogs.
CLIs: ds-lite time { endtime-second-dec | endtime-second-hex | starttime-second-dec | starttime-second-hex | starttime } { local | utc }
ds-lite time { timestamp-second-dec | timestamp-second-hex | timestamp } { local | utc }
undo ds-lite time { endtime-second-dec | endtime-second-hex | starttime-second-dec | starttime-second-hex | starttime } { local | utc }
undo ds-lite time { timestamp-second-dec | timestamp-second-hex | timestamp } { local | utc }

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The format of DS-Lite syslog information can be flexibly configured. To configure a device to display the local time in flexible DS-Lite syslogs, run the ds-lite time command.
Prerequisites
A flexible NAT syslog template has been created, and the flexible log template view is displayed.
Precautions
The ds-lite time command takes precedence over the ds-lite time local command run in the flexible log template view. If the ds-lite time command is run, the time format of the end time, start time, or timestamp takes effect according to the configured format. If the ds-lite time command is not run, the ds-lite time local command takes effect. If neither the ds-lite time command nor the ds-lite time local command is run, the default UTC time takes effect.
